image.altText: Soldiers in combat fatigues stand on a street at night

props.synopsis: At least 20 people have been killed in a series of fresh explosions targeting communications devices used by the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah. Follow live.

title.children: Fresh explosions in Lebanon hit Hezbollah hand-held radios, killing 20 and wounding hundreds

image.altText: Smoke billows from a small shop as people and fire-fighters stand outside it looking on

props.synopsis: A wave of fresh explosions hit hand-held radios used by members of the Hezbollah militant group in Lebanon.

title.children: Hezbollah walkie-talkies explode a day after pager attack

image.altText: Three students thumbs up leaning on minibus that says burketown state school

props.synopsis: While city slickers complain about long commutes to work, bush students travelling a 240km round trip to school each day are enjoying the ride.

title.children: The longest school bus run in Queensland no bother for these outback kids

image.altText: A wide shot of a strip of shops with cars parked in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Two men involved in a fatal bashing in Darwin's northern suburbs have pleaded guilty to violence charges, while a third man charged with murder awaits a court hearing next year.

title.children: Pair involved in fatal Darwin bashing plead guilty to violent act causing death

image.altText: Portrait of woman sitting on a couch holding a white mug of tea

props.synopsis: When a town in Australia's South West was forced to switch off gas, residents were given a choice: use bottled gas or electrify. Now, electricity is providing more energy for Esperance than ever before and most of it is coming from renewable sources.

title.children: Forced to switch off gas, this small Australian seaside town became a 'microcosm of what the world is trying to do'

image.altText: A photo of a gas exploration project. The image is taken by a drone and shows a busy mine.

props.synopsis: The NT Supreme Court has rejected an environmental group's legal challenge of the approval of a fracking exploration project in the Beetaloo Basin, finding it failed to make out its grounds for review.

title.children: NT Supreme Court rejects legal bid against Beetaloo fracking exploration approval

image.altText: Men holding flags in front of the parliament 'Beehive' building.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has entered a period of right-wing politics, but the next generation of Māori activists are ready to respond.

title.children: A plan taking shape in New Zealand could 'bring crazies out of the woodwork'

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking publicly outdoors, wearing a suit with a yellow ribbon pinned on the lapel.

props.synopsis: We have reached that point in the political cycle where the parliamentary clock is running down, opinion polls are being taken more seriously, and various efforts are underway to define the ground on which the election will be fought.

title.children: Labor's housing reform plans failed, now IR is in its sights

image.altText: An Australian senator in a red jacket.

props.synopsis: Senators found many medical students get just an hour of training in the subject despite half the country going through it at some stage.

title.children: 'Irrational, hysterical or crazy': Senate inquiry recommends reproductive leave for all as it calls for medical profession to step up

image.altText: A man is handcuffed and walked down a street.

props.synopsis: The AFP says Jay Je Yoon Jung seemed surprised when he was arrested in a dawn raid. For nearly a decade he had operated the Ghost app with relative anonymity.

title.children: The 'socially awkward' karaoke lover who allegedly created an app for the underworld

image.altText: Composite image of RBA governor Michele Bullock and US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell.

props.synopsis: As the US starts cutting interest rates, what does it mean for the Reserve Bank's fight against inflation?

title.children: The US has begun cutting interest rates and there are implications for Australia

image.altText: A composite image of a statue of Jesus, a white cross, and piles of coffins.

props.synopsis: The high cost of burials is forcing Papua New Guinea families to abandon the bodies of loved ones at its public morgue, and many are ending up in mass graves.

title.children: Papua New Guineans 'think that they can avoid death'. When it happens, families are forced into mass burials

image.altText: A collage that shows the faces of four men, next to the scales justice

props.synopsis: The NSW government supports all 19 recommendations from a landmark inquiry into historical gay hate crimes, saying victims and their families were "fundamentally failed" in the past and it can never occur again.

title.children: Police minister says report into LGBT hate crimes was 'deeply difficult' reading

image.altText: Delegates sit in a semi-circle shape and look at a large stage and screens.

props.synopsis: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly supports a resolution demanding Israel end its occupation of Gaza and the occupied West Bank within a year, but Australia abstains from the vote.

title.children: Australia abstains as UN General Assembly votes to demand Israel end Palestinian occupation

image.altText: Husic is sitting holding a pen, left arm braced against desk

props.synopsis: An offshore gas project slated for the New South Wales coast has been dealt another blow after Industry Minister Ed Husic issued a preliminary rejection.

title.children: Gas project at the centre of Scott Morrison's secret portfolio takeover scandal receives preliminary rejection

image.altText: Close-up of a restaurant waiter handing over food packets to a woman customer.

props.synopsis: PFAS chemicals are used in a vast number of waterproof, non-stick and stain-resistant products. But concerns about their environmental and potential health impacts have intensified in recent years.

title.children: PFAS 'forever chemicals' are all around us. What does it mean for our health?

image.altText: A young woman in a dimly lit venue.

props.synopsis: Organising a night out is exhausting work for young people with disabilities like Alessa — from checking the terrain, doorways, entrances, and adequate space for a wheelchair.

title.children: When a simple night out on the town can take weeks of research

image.altText: Kids sit on the floor in a room reading a book. The room is crowded with a desk, couch and beds.

props.synopsis: World Vision estimates almost one million children have been forced out of school since the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title.children: Aid agency says regression in children due to the ongoing conflict in Ukraine is worse than people realise

image.altText: A teenager wearing a flanelette shirt stands under a bridge while looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A recent survey found one in five young people are experiencing financial hardship, with impacts on mental health and wellbeing. Experts say many young people are giving up on their dreams as cost-of-living pressures continue.

title.children: The 'vicious cycle' facing young Australians today

image.altText: A woman in striped shirt looks at fecund valley farming green

props.synopsis: Almost 50 candidates across Victoria have been elected to local councils unopposed due to a lack of nominations, which the Municipal Association of Victoria says is not ideal but preferable to outright vacancies.

title.children: Almost 50 candidates elected unopposed across Victoria without competition for seats

image.altText: A picture of Aunty Lesley Williams with an inset of Queen Elizabeth II.

props.synopsis: Aunty Lesley Williams spent six months' wages on a deb ball gown to "come out" to a society that didn't accept her. This week, she was the first to share her story at a truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: 'I wanna look like the queen': Lesley spent six months' wages on a deb ball gown for a society that didn't accept her

image.altText: A graphic of Betty Shanks photo with newspaper clippings following her death around it.

props.synopsis: The 22-year-old's battered body was found lying in a garden with a bloodstained tram ticket still clutched in her hand.

title.children: Betty Shanks was murdered walking home in Brisbane 72 years ago. Some believe her killer can still be found

image.altText: Illustration of space capsule with three figures sitting inside

props.synopsis: With NASA's crewed mission to the moon only a year away, first results from radiation experiments onboard Artemis 1 suggest short trips are within human limits, but longer missions or travel to Mars may be challenging.

title.children: Phantom dummies on NASA's uncrewed Artemis mission highlight radiation risk to astronauts

image.altText: A young girl smiles widely as she hugs a scruffy, large dog. They are sitting on the tray of a ute with clear sky behind them.

props.synopsis: If you've never heard of the kangaroo dog, you're not alone. But it has an incredible story to tell about Australia's Indigenous and colonial history.

title.children: Ever heard of the roo dog? The fierce hunter was bred to kill and has a special place in Aussie history

image.altText: CHILD CARE Anthony Albanese, Jason Clare

props.synopsis: The government asked the Productivity Commission to consider options for universal child care, but its preferred option is not cost-free for everyone.

title.children: Universal child care could be on the way, but it doesn’t mean a free-for-all

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape at a Brisbane rugby league match in 2022.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese indicates Papua New Guinea is a step closer to entering a team in the NRL.

title.children: Albanese reiterates support for Papua New Guinea NRL club as talks continue with ARLC

image.altText: Albanese presser stern

props.synopsis: The federal government has failed to bring its first home buyer support scheme to a vote in the Senate, with the Greens and the Coalition voting together to delay consideration of the legislation for two months.

title.children: The government has been unable to bring on a vote that would have killed its own housing policy

image.altText: A group of men cross or raise their arms while standing in front of a makeshift blockade made of timber.

props.synopsis: There are concerns for dozens of Australian and New Zealander hikers on the Kokoda Track after local landowners set up a blockade, forcing authorities to suddenly close the famous route in Papua New Guinea.

title.children: Concerns for 'exhausted' Australian hikers as landowners form Kokoda Track blockade

image.altText: Harris speaks into a microphone in front of a red American flag wearing a beige suit

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris's bid for the US presidency has become a key target of Russian disinformation campaigners focusing on the Democratic campaign, Microsoft says.

title.children: 'Hit-and-run' deepfake video targeting Kamala Harris was spread by 'Kremlin-aligned troll farm', Microsoft says

image.altText: Protesters in high-vis wearing sunglasses hold signs and march

props.synopsis: Trade workers are threatening three days of strikes after walking off the job in Melbourne and Sydney to protest against the federal government's decision to force the CFMEU's construction arm into administration.

title.children: Threat of major escalation of industrial action as tens of thousands of workers march in Melbourne and Sydney against CFMEU administration

image.altText: A green crocodile leather bag sits on display in front of a vinnie's sign saying it's $2000

props.synopsis: A keen-eyed worker at an op shop spotted a "designer" find that retails for $4,000. The handbag, believed to have been made by luxury brand Balenciaga, was put on sale for half that price, but the store has received backlash on social media.

title.children: Op shop puts 'designer Balenciaga bag' on sale for $2,000, prompting backlash

image.altText: PROXY: Tupperware

props.synopsis: Tupperware Brands filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday, giving in to dwindling demand for its once-iconic food storage containers and mounting financial losses.

title.children: Tupperware files for bankruptcy as its colourful containers lose relevance

image.altText: A tree silhouetted by the glowing pink lights of the aurora australis

props.synopsis: Get outside just as the sun is going down this evening to see the supermoon rising above the horizon.

title.children: The bright moon dulled last night's aurora. But expect a supermoon spectacle tonight
